page.title: 05THE JEPHSON GARDENS.
page.content: The beautifully kept Jephson Gardens are situated on the banks of the River Leam, and have entrances on the Lower Parade, Newbold Terrace and Willes Rd. Mr Willes gave the land for the gardens but they were named after Dr. Henry Jephson. Monuments were erected in their memory. The Jephson Gardens cover an area of thirteen and a half acres. There are four fountains in the gardens. Two are modelled on the fountains at Hampton Court. The Hitchman Fountain no longer works being blocked with cedar needles. The Czech Fountain commemorates Czech Parachutists killed in World War2. The nurseries in the middle of the Gardens grow plants for decorating The Parade boarders, Pump Room Gardens and the Flower Clock which this year commemorates International Youth Year.
